question_text: A 24-year-old woman is evaluated for dysuria without associated vaginal discharge.Urine microscopy is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: Cystitis (Option B) is the most likely diagnosis. The presence of leukocytes (shown, arrows) in the urine along with urinary symptoms is typically associated with a urinary tract infection. Leukocytes are fairly large cells with intracellular granular material and multilobed nuclei. Bacteria are also often seen on microscopy in patients with cystitis before antibiotic administration.
